Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: William_Helgason
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, and the staff was friendly and helpful, but this hotel is not worth the $180.- a night we paid. The decor is quite dated, and a bit shabby, just like the building itself. The room was of a good size (3 bed room for two people) but lacked furniture, and again, dated decor and a bit shabby. The TV was an old tube, with only one English channel (BBC News). The WiFi was free, but was constantly dropping connections. Breakfast below average. Can not recommend this hotel, and there is no way it merits 4 stars, or the pricetag.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Inna J
Reviews.Content: We loved it very much. Especially because of the great location, in the city center - we didn't use metro or buses, all the important places were near, you can walk anywhere. In special cases use the metro for farer locations (like Vatican). The room was big and also the bathroom. We were there 8 days, and every day the bed was changed and the bathroom was shiny! The breakfast was very nice, aspecially for Italy. In conclusion, we think it was great hotel for the price and really recommend on it.

Reviews.Title: “1+4 and by chance...”
Reviews.Author: Mirene-Mirene
Reviews.Content: I got here really by chance. The hotel Villa Pinciana which I'd booked initially turned out to have some repairs just on the day I came so they sent me to the Sistina - taking into account that I'd written to the hotel in advance, informing I was going to come, it didn't characterise the Leonardi chain in a good way. Anyway, it's not about the Sistina Hotel. The first room I had was really unpleasant: it was gloomy and the a/c unit was placed in the position so that it blew into my ear - no difference where I tried to lie on their (really good, though) double bed. In the morning I asked for another room and got it. So my mark is distributed between these two rooms: the first has got "zero", the second (for 4 more nights) the rest of the four points. What is really great about the Sistina is its LOCATION: just in Via Sistina connecting Piazza Barberini (with the underground station) and Trinita dei Monti. So in 5 minutes you can reach perhaps the most romantic point in Rome - the top of the Spanish Steps. Splendid! The ROOM (my second one) was good enough, with a nice bed, efficient a/c (in the right place this time!), a safe, a mini-bar and a spacious bathroom. Two things were not so pleasant but I'm sure the hotel can take care of that: the smell coming from the bathroom was terrible: smoke! I don't smoke and hate this smell, so my deodorant turned out to be helpful at that point. Another thing - there are some little details in the room - some carving on the door, pictures - all these objects could be cleaner if you ask me. But in general I was happy in this room. BREAKFAST was good with quite a wide choice. The STAFF were friendly - and I'm really thankful to the signore who changed the room for me. After all, I paid for a single, but ended up in a double. In general, I think this hotel has a good potential: the main aim is to pay more attention to cleaning and destroying this horrible smell of smoke. And - sorry - it's my personal opinion, but I'd remove pictures of Madonna which hang above beds. Italy has got so many great artists with their Madonnas - much better to look at reproductions of masterpieces than at these doll-like faces... Anyway, four out of my 5 nights here were really good and the price I paid was quite reasonable for the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggie909
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very centrally located -- 2-3 minute walk to Spanish Steps, one block away from Barberini metro station. Staff was so nice. A/C didn't work well the first night but it was repaired immediately when we complained and worked great the rest of stay. Breakfast was included and was very good, especially for a small hotel. We had triple room that was very spacious with a king bed and a twin bed in a separate room/alcove. Free wireless internet throughout the hotel. Overall great experience. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonicreducer8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located two blocks from the top of the Spanish steps. It was a quick walk to anywhere in the city. We felt very safe in this area and often walked around, sat and watched in the piazza's in this area. The hotel was very clean. The size of the hotel room was very nice but what caught us by surprise was the size of the bathroom! It was not your typical small European bathroom and was rather large. The breakfast was a continental breakfast which was served for a 3 hours. The food was good and so was the coffee. The service and the front desk spoke wonderful English and were extremely helpful and kind. All in all i would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - hotel OK but more of a 3 star by British standards”
Reviews.Author: digitalphoto
Reviews.Content: The Sistina is perfectly located for a holiday in Rome - it's central, and all the must-see sites are easily walkable for an able bodied person. The hotel itself is OK if you only going to use it as a base. It's quite small, and although it's faux marble decor has charm, it needs a bit of a facelift. Our room was pretty standard, with air-conditioning, a safe for personal belongings, and a spacious bathroom. Several of the reviews here say the hotel is smelly-we had no experience of any smells so cannot agree with this. The soundproofing was pretty good, considering that Rome is just about the noisiest city on earth. Parking? This is Rome-are you crazy? No chance! Breakfast is standard continental fare, and exactly what we expected - tea, coffee, cooked meats and cheeses, cereal, croissants, juices and fruit. You can return to the buffet as many times as you want. If you're expecting a cooked breakfast go to Blackpool instead. There is a tiny roof garden where you can have breakfast served, but this information is not volunteered, you have to ask (and pay for the privilege, probably). There is no tea or coffee facility in the rooms either- this is a disappointment, and much needed after a hot day slogging around Rome. You can get room service to bring you hot drinks in the room, but this will be added to your bill. There is no restaurant for an evening meal but there are several within yards of the hotel, so it's not a problem. The staff were generally very courteous, especially if you made the effort to speak a few basic words of Italian. Their English isn't great - but why should it be? They're italians in their own country. A couple of tips about Rome in general: 1) Rome is not at all pushchair or wheelchair friendly. The footpaths are very narrow and bumpy, with no ramps to assist crossing the roads. Traffic is completely mental and you need to be careful. Most of the roads are cobbled and have cracks and potholes. There are lots of italians standing around chatting in groups on the streets-don't expect them to get out of your way-they won't. 2) Don't waste your money on bottled water. Buy one small bottle then top it up regularly from the waterspouts that are all over the city. The water is fresh, clean and palatable-and free! I've stayed in many city hotels and the Sistina is as good as most, and better than some.

Reviews.Title: “hotel too old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Brennan17
Reviews.Content: Good location. From the inside pocket of my jacket, 250 $ is gone. Hotel too old and dirty.Decor very old.The rudeness of the waitress plans.Bar non-existent.I asked for a water bottle in the room and i said no.How had 4 stars. I was in Rome years ago and i remained great memories but this time i was very very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: happibunni
Reviews.Content: Again, after reading other reviews on this site, I was very nervous about our trip to the Sistina Hotel, and again my worries were unfounded. This Hotel is probably one of the most central in Rome, close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Veneto and many, many more beautiful places. We had a beautiful room and loved every second of our stay. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast substantial enough to keep us going until 3pm in the afternoon when we stopped walking and had a late lunch in one of the many taverna's. All in all a wonderful experience and we will definately stay there when next we travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money, staff speak english”
Reviews.Author: kikka1
Reviews.Content: Our holiday was purely cultural. The hotel was situation right in the heart of Rome. One side the Spanish Steps and the other side Piazza Barberini. Excellent location. Barberini Metro was only 2 minutes away by walk. There were also 2 or 3 Tavola Calda in the same street, quite convenient. Rooms are comfortable and quite spacious. Bathrooms clean with amenities included. The room had a TV and a telephone as well as a mini bar. All the staff spoke English and were very polite as well as friendly. Breakfast was abundant and well presented. We were there the week before Christmas and the rates we paid were great. Good value for money. Would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, the heating doesn't work, nasty smell in the lobby, impolite receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Lexxisz
Reviews.Content: I staiyed in this hotel about 2 weeks ago, for a week. At first they gave me a room at the last floor of the hotel, the 4th floor, a small room, where I could'nt have natural light, there was dust in the room, and the in the bathroom there was no heating, it was frosty and the doors from the shower cabin couldn't be closed properly. It was impossible for me to sleep in such horrible conditions. The next day, I asked to change my room and they gave another, from the third floor, that was better than the other. But the big problem here, was that i had heating only for 2 nights out of 6, although outside there it was very cold (-6/-8 Celsius degrees night). What i liked least it was that in a rainy night, it started to rain in my room also. It oozed water through my ceiling because at the 4th floor, above my room there was the terrace of the hotel. What I liked best it was the breakfast at the hotel, that was diversified and especially the cakes were delicious. Also, the location of this hotel is very good, right in the city center, at 2 minutes from the underground and also from the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is old, tired and smelly and badly needs refurbishing.”
Reviews.Author: LouiseandSam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times now and have never got the room I requested. The breakfast is poor and the coffee would have to be the worst in Italy if not the world. Do you believe they have an espresso machine but stew up some vile brew in the back kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Sistina Hotel claims 4 stars, really is 3 stars in most amenities”
Reviews.Author: Probityman
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is fairly good, being above the Spanish steps. Subway and bus close at hand. Fairly quiet as to outside noise, rooms large enough. Breakfast in hotel dining room is typical Italian, nothing special and never changes one day to another. Laptops can only be used in the lobby and suffered from frequent malfunctions, poor service. Helpful staff, English spoken. Lighting in the bathroom among the worst I've ever seen in any hotel above 2 stars. Noisy doors, poor sound insulation between rooms. The below recommendation is based on service, price, and location; it is not truly a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: dgrant11
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel should have zero stars - dirty, run down and our room smelled like a sewer. I asked for a room change - it stank of cigarette smoke so we stayed in the sewer. The front desk staff just gave us a blank stare. The location was good - walking distance to central rome - but I would stay below the Piazza di Spagna to avoid the steps.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SesaAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 2 night stay at the Sistina and we would never stay there again. We cannot believe that they claim to be a 4 star hotel, 2 star is probably more like it. The hotel is old world which is lovely but it is very run down, in immediate need of TLC. The constant smell of smoke in the hotel used to make me sick. I could smell the smoke in our room, on the second floor, first thing in the morning. The breakfast was a terrible experience. Food not fresh and breakfast area not clean. The juices used to make me sick just looking at them, they looked very cloudy and weren't replaced daily. Bocconcini were soft and slimy and cold meats not fresh. Pastries were kept in a warmer and I couldn't understand why as the italian pastries are amazing and delicious when eaten fresh. I worked out that the pastries used were ones from the supermarket sold in packs of six. They can't even serve fresh pastries???? The coffee is the worst I've ever had and I actually couldn't drink it. Front desk staff were okay but they need to give up smoking outside the front door as the smell travels through the whole hotel. Amazing location but not enough to make us forget the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: catz2006
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the stay in this hotel. Air conditioning not functioning, unproffessional staff and as you walked from reception to lift-there was a damp odour. Hotel is not a four star.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kiasmum
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and the Hotel Sistina couldn't have been a better choice. Centrally located and within easy reach of all the sights. Friendly and helpful staff-who appreciated our efforts with their language. Rooms a bit tired but clean.Bed was comfortable and the bathroom really quite luxurious.Plenty of choice at breakfast. Would we book again?-yes.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sistina Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: nseaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my first trip to Rome... The hotel was in a cracking location... 2mins from the Spanish Steps which is fairly much the most central part of Rome The hotel was clean and tidy.. Rooms were a bit dated but the Bathroom was HUGE and lovely ! I would recommend this hotel due to its great location. Ideal for those weekend trips to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 28A
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 4 nights here and could not have been more pleased. From the way my early email queries were answered to the very last transfer arrangement, everything was handled in a friendly, efficient and caring manner. I felt that the management really wanted us to have a good holiday.. and we did...The location, near the Spanish Steps, was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: MugsyO
Reviews.Content: Our two nights at the Sistina Hotel were among the longest nights of my life. Rome was our last stop on a 3-city tour of Italy, and we had stayed at a 4-star hotel in each city we visited. Each hotel was great, except the Sistina. We couldn't believe that it was considered a "4-star" hotel. There was only one staff member working there at a time, so we were on our own to find our room. Our room and the hallways stank of smoke, the furniture was old and dingy, the television set was tiny and had no english-speaking channels and the air conditioning was so bad that we ended up switching to a smaller room (which, because of its size, cooled a bit easier). The staff members were not friendly at all, and the breakfast buffet was sub-par (especially compared with the breakfasts we received at the other Italian hotels) and the breakfast area didn't seem particularly clean. The only thing going for the hotel was the location, but that just wasn't enough to make us forget about everything else.

Reviews.Title: “We lucked into the Sistina!”
Reviews.Author: deranieri
Reviews.Content: When another hotel refused to honor a confirmed reservation, we wound up at the Sistina. What a delightful surprise - great staff, great room, perfect location, beautiful public rooms, and a great breakfast. The only drawback was the weak A/C; but, then, we were in Rome during a brutal heat wave. We probably did better at this hotel than our original pick. Next time, we'll just book here FIRST.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, really bad and really really bad!”
Reviews.Author: Flyingredhorse
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and booked a twin room. We could only guess how this hotel could be rated 4 Stars..Maybe because if offers hairdryers and sometimes eggs at breaksfast? What it does not have is any news or tv channel in English. Upon arrival there was not a doorman (never was) nor a bellman. We found in our room-a toliet that did not stop running, a shower that took 15 minutes to get hot water, gaps in the marble to the door in the bath. The twin was two tiny rooms just large enough to get a twin in each room. The woodwork was dirty and the wallpaper was peeling and also dirty. The last night my husband called from the states and I had to go down to the lobby and talk to him at the front desk because they could not get the call to go through to our room. They called to tell us our phone didn't work. Read again- they called to tell us that our phone did not work. Once downstairs I was told there was not another phone available in the entire hotel. So our conversation on the hotel switchboard was brief as we had to hang up when the phone rang. We asked for a taxi to be called to take us to the airport but was told the hotel used a car service and on and on. We felt very taken advantage of with paying what we did for the room. It was not a 4 Star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little overated”
Reviews.Author: RichLI
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, not sure it deserves a 4 star rating. There are NO amenities at this hotel. The staff however was great. To sum up the room were a little beat and the hotel a little run down. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tsebvickie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sistina is ideally placed to see all the attractions in Rome by foot. I didn't think it was worth a 4 star rating - however, it was clean, secure and the staff were polite which is pretty much all you need. And compared with some of the horror stories you hear about hotels in Rome we were quite happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but certainly not 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Hector1
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sistina recently as part of a large group. Some of the rooms were of a 4 star standard, others were not. Unfortunately ours was the latter. The location of the hotel however was excellent with easy walks to many of the major tourist sights. Breakfast was adequate. Pictures that I have seen on the website of the roof top terrace are very misleading, making it look more attractive than it actually is, don't imagine that you'll be sitting up there with a bottle of wine admiring the view. On the whole though, a pleasant stay was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “If only the coffee were good”
Reviews.Author: Lorene
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very good, and it met our needs. You cannot beat the location. It was clean and the staff was helpful. The breakfast was adequate. Our only complaint is that they serve instant coffee. One day I asked for capuccino, and that was weak and watery.This is unforgiveable in Italy where great coffee is ubiquitous. For 225 euros a night they can do a little better. Lorraine

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for weekend visit 12th to 14th May. Hotel was lovely; from the welcome and assistance from the gentleman who checked us in (and directed us to a wonderful restaurant with what can only be described as oodles of character) to the lady who kept the substantial breakfast topped up. It is not a large grand hotel, rather a welcoming boutique type. Our room was large with plenty of room for desk, chairs, armchairs and the bathroom was of a good size as well. The position is perfect, being along the road from the top of the Spanish Steps & within walking distance from the other sight. Also just down from a Metro station. Some areas are in need of minor refurbishment but that did not detract from our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is UNREAL! Sistina is a boutique hotel just down the road from the Spanish Steps and Via Cavour. A great walk to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The room was very nice, not quite as glamorous as the internet pic (are they ever?), bed linen and towels were of high quality and very clean. The only prob we had was that the airconditioner was faulty and there was about a metre square of soaked carpet underneath it, but when we complained, the manager gave us a substantial room discount, so we really didn't mind so much! One of the best memories we have of Rome was a meal of pizza, birra and vino (from just around the corner in Via Capo Lie Case) - eaten on the tiny rooftop of Hotel Sistina while watching the sun go down over Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel near sights”
Reviews.Author: Stewart166
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sistina Nice hotel with pleasant room, good location for visiting sights. 5 minutes walk to Spanish Steps. 15 minutes to Trevi, walking distance to other sights up to 40 minutes to Vatican. Lovely city to walk round. Breakfast was good, with a varied selection always topped up. Hotel offered to collect us and take us back to Airport, which we would have taken if we weren't travelling by train. Rooms were comfortable, good air conditioning. Staff always friendly and smiling. Would definately revisit to see the other sights!!!

Reviews.Title: “barely three stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, it is easy to walk to all the main Rome's historical monuments. The quality of the hotel does not respond to four stars standard at all. Rooms are very small, bed in our double room was very small, the shower was not working properly, air conditioning was very noisy, we could hear everything what was in neigbouring rooms happening. We paid EUR 160 per room per night. For two thirds of this prize it would be a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Italian conditions”
Reviews.Author: pinkelvis
Reviews.Content: We recently (end of may 2004) stayed at the Sistina. The first room I was offered was rather a cave than a room. After complaining at the desk I got a reasonable but also not four-star-worth room (very small room and bed, outworn mattress). The next three days we had a double room, which was also on a basic three-star level. We can confirm that the desk is friendly on an Italian basis. However, the management is not able to cope with matters of course (water was coming from the ceiling, there was a problem in the room above us and they were not able to clean our bathroom, which was floated). However, we got a deduction for the last night. The location is good, shopping area and Spanish Steps are very close. In the rooms you almost hear no traffic (which is rather seldom in Rome), but due to thin walls you have the plaesure to hear your neighbour fart.

HotelInfo.Name: Leonardi Sistina Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sistina 136 | Piazza di Spagna, 00187 Rome, Italy
